info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 24 at 3:34PM PST until December 25 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT ABOVE 2000 FEET UNTIL SATURDAY EVENING THEN ALL LOCATIONS SATURDAY NIGHT UNTIL 7 AM PST MONDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST SATURDAY ABOVE 1500 FEET... * WHAT...Through Saturday evening, for the Winter Storm Warning above 2000 feet, heavy snow accumulations of 6 to 15 inches, and locally higher amounts up to 25 inches. For the Winter Weather Advisory above 1500 feet, accumulating snow of 4 to 9 inches. Through Saturday night into Monday morning, a Winter Storm Warning down to the Rogue Valley floor (1000 feet), new snow accumulations of around 5 inches below 1500 feet and 5 to 15 inches above 1500 feet with locally higher amounts up to 30 inches in eastern Douglas County. * WHERE...For the winter storm warning, elevations about 2000 feet in the eastern Douglas County Foothills and Jackson County and then all locations starting Saturday night. For the winter weather advisory, elevations above 1500 feet in the eastern Douglas County Foothills and Jackson County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 7 AM PST Monday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 10 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A lull is expected Saturday morning and afternoon where warming temperatures may melt existing snow below 1500 feet in Jackson County. Elsewhere above 1500 feet on Saturday morning (roughly 4 AM to 10 AM PST), there should be a lull in new snowfall less than 2 inches (though higher amounts of fresh snowfall around 3 to 5 inches in the higher terrain of Eastern Douglas County County are possible). * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
